flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=5000>>5000 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 5000*$.0.25=$1250<<5000*0.25=1250>>1250 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 5000*$.0.5=$2500<<5000*0.5=2500>>2500 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $1250+$2500=$3750<<1250+2500=3750>>3750 total.
#### 3750

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 500, not 5000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
